inn1.comm: Cook starts with a cut, gets it away to third man for a single
tempting line outside off from McKay and gets some away swing, Bell lets it through to Haddin
McKay gets this one wrong, swinging it down leg side for a very wide wide
Bell goes for a drive outside off and this skews off a thickish outside edge behind point, he picks up a couple of runs
plenty of swing here for McKay but again it's too much movement - this one curves too wide of off and is called a wide
outswing again but not quite as wide and Bell just watches this through to Haddin
more accurate now as McKay probes on off stump and Bell defends a short-of-a-length delivery
Bell comes forward now and ends up just defending this back towards McKay
accurate immediately at 140kph, Cook defends this from off stump

and Johnson now finds what McKay has already discovered - it ain't easy controlling this swing. This one curves well wide of off and almost to first slip. Wide signalled by umpire John Ward, who is on his ODI debut
beaten outside off! Lovely delivery, just moves away enough to beat the bat of Cook, who was dabbing at this
outside off stump again and this one Cook leaves alone
Johnson goes fuller, aiming for the yorker at 146kph, but it's not quite full enough for a yorker and Cook pushes to leg
Cook gets some width now and it's a touch shorter, he's happy to punch this through cover and pick up a couple more runs
this one swings in just a touch and Cook defends solidly towards off
McKay moves this in to the right-hander Bell, who defends
Bell leans out to defend once more, he's making a watchful start

a shout from the Australians here as this one swings down leg and Bell goes for a glance, Haddin makes a diving take. Umpire Dharmasena says not out, but also doesn't signal wide, indicating perhaps that was off thigh pad. Replays suggest it may have missed everything - McKay probably lucky that wasn't called wide
worked away to the leg side
Cook is defending off the back foot now
on the pads now and Cook flicks it away towards fine leg, just ticking the scoreboard over gently at this stage
again Johnson beats Cook outside off! Really had him squared up here, angled in towards off and just straightening enough, Cook's feet go nowhere and he's lucky not to edge this
Cook picks up the first boundary of the innings, just a casual sort of flick through square leg as Johnson gives him one on middle and leg
steered away towards fine leg and Faulkner does the fielding
Johnson bangs this one in short and Bell works it away off the body behind square, awkward delivery
solidly defended by Cook
left alone outside off as Johnson gives Cook a bit more width
cut away behind point for a single
Cook cuts hard but finds point
Cook again goes for the cut but this one beats the bat - Coulter-Nile giving him a little width here
on the pads now and Cook is easily able to work this to fine leg for a single
on off stump now and Bell defends
shortish and wideish and cuttish to third mannish
Johnson bangs it in towards the hips, Bell just works it down towards leg
bouncer, nice and accurate too but Bell is keen to play, tries to sway back and steer it over the cordon but doesn't connect - Johnson is interested in a caught behind appeal but Haddin isn't
Bell has had enough of waiting around, he flashes outside off and crunches Johnson uppishly through cover for his first boundary
Bell drives hard again, this time along the ground and straight to mid-off
nearly played on! Bell defends outside off and this skews off the inside edge just past the stumps - that was close!
fuller from Johnson and that allows Bell to play that late cut that he enjoys, just steers this safely along the ground to third man
Bell launches at this, tries to drive Coulter-Nile through mid-off but finds the fielder
width from Coulter-Nile and Bell is keen to go after him, throws the bat at this and lobs him over cover but the ball pulls up well inside the boundary
now Cook is taking on Coulter-Nile, too, with a lovely cover drive that is chased down by McKay with a sliding save on the boundary
Bell picks up a boundary this time, nice attractive shot too as he clips off his pads wide of mid-on and although it was uppishly struck it was safe, lovely placement
and wouldn't you know it, a slip comes out and Bell edges this one through the new gap, though angled it down so it wasn't really catchable height - third man collects
defended towards the off side now
Cook defends a delivery that came at him at 125kph
on the pads now and Cook waits on it, clips comfortably through midwicket but it's chased down inside the boundary by Maxwell
McKay continues at his usual high 120s speed, Bell steers this late cut safely away for another run
cuts hard into the turf and straight to point
McKay hurls this one down with a Sharapova-like grunt, Cook nudges off the pads to midwicket
poor ball, short and down leg side and all Cook had to do was help this on its way to fine leg - which he did. McKay is chastising himself at that delivery
defended towards the off side
Bell looks to smash Coulter-Nile over midwicket now but miscues away to the off side
hmmm, Bell has nearly thrown it away here as he tries to launch it over mid-off and it lobs up in the air, Faulkner runs back from mid-off and nearly gets to it - Bell is lucky to survive there
beaten outside off now as Coulter-Nile angles it across and draws Cook into the drive
pushed away towards mid-off
driven away to mid-off once again
accurate from McKay on off stump, Bell just defends after a couple of more adventurous swings at Coulter-Nile last over
Bell walks down the pitch, keen to get the scoreboard moving further, McKay drags the length back and makes Bell defend
horribly wide of off now, McKay has done this a few times today, just squirting it far too wide
now Bell gets some width and goes with it, takes a swing at McKay and scoops this up over point and the ball runs away to the boundary, confident shot and well executed by Bell

he continues to have a real crack does Bell, tries the big aerial straight drive and doesn't quite middle it, Bailey running back from mid-on can't quite get there in time and has to content himself with keeping it to two runs
left alone outside off
Bell walks at McKay again and defends
starts at 132kph and fullish outside off, Cook drives to mid-off
Faulkner hurries in again, he almost looks like he's trying to sneak up on the batsman with his quick action, Cook works it away to square leg
Bell cuts hard when he gets some width, Maxwell does the fielding out on the point boundary
Cook drags one from wide of off through midwicket now, made that ball go through the gap he'd identified, though the two runs he wanted can't happen
fuller on the pads, Bell pushes to leg
late cut again, Bell does love that shot, and it continues to bring him safe runs
tossed up on the pads and Bell works it through midwicket

Maxwell strikes! Around the wicket to Cook, who drives at a half-volley but does nothing more than send it back in the direction of the bowler, who takes a sharp catch low to his right. Cook will be kicking himself!
Root drives but can't beat point - there's a really tight field inside the ring to try to keep Root on strike
Root is a touch lucky here, gets it away fine off the toe of the bat to get himself off the mark
driven down towards mid-on
fullish from Maxwell, not giving it time to turn, Root drives to mid-off with a clunky sort of sound
soft hands from Bell as he just guides this one through square leg for a single
accurate at 143kph and Root defends
uppishly driven, very uppishly driven towards mid-off and Root is fortunate he didn't get a fraction more on that as it's bounced just short of the fielder
again shouts of "catch it!" as Root drives at a fullish Johnson ball and lobs it up short of point

Johnson gets Root! It seemed inevitable, and it's an lbw that gets him. Johnson gets this one to swing back in a fraction, at pace, and the only thing as slow as Root's attempt to get the bat down in time is Dharmasena's delayed decision to give that out. As he did in the first ODI, Root wants a review and as was the case then, he is still out. It was an umpire's call, replays suggesting it would have hit the leg bail. Really ungainly shot by Root, who just couldn't handle the pace
swings this one down leg
shortish at 142kph but it's outside off, so Ballance isn't in danger - though he dabbed the bat at it perhaps unnecessarily
tossed up on the stumps from around the wicket, Bell now with two partners gone is happy to just work this through midwicket
very full from Maxwell, Ballance drives at it but mistimes it towards short cover
tossed up more this time and a touch of turn, Ballance nudges a single past short cover now
quicker and angled across Bell, who defends
Maxwell strays onto the pads now and Bell comfortably flicks a single through square leg
again Maxwell tosses it up and tries to draw Ballance into the drive, he does go at it but mistimes
nearly strikes immediately! Tossed up outside off and Bell pushes at it, the inside edge just misses the stumps!
on the back foot, crunched to short cover
Clarke is tossing this up, slowly, and Ballance drives down through mid-on
Bell uses the feet now and just drives a safe single down to long-on
driven through midwicket for another single
tossed up wide of off, Bell was advancing and had to adjust for the width and turn, did well in the end to steer through point and pick up a couple of runs
turns this one to the leg side for a single
this delivery heading down the leg side to backward square
defended on the front foot by Ballance
drills this one straight to silly mid-off, who makes a valiant dive to stop it
plays this away to the off side
driven straight down the ground to the fielder at long-off to end the over
bowls one on a length which is defended to the leg side
looks for the gap through the off side, but finds the fielder
this time looking to get past silly mid-on, but the fielder is equal to the task
played to the off side, but no run on offer
once again played to the same man as Ballance is itching for a single
played off the back foot as this is worked away to backward square for a single
pitches this a bit wider as he drives this straight to the man at sweeper cover, with the pair able to complete a couple

and Maxwell beats an increasingly fidgety Ballance as he lofts one just around off stump, with the flight drawing Ballance down the track before the left-hander, trying to work this leg side, misses the ball completely, and turns around just in time to see Haddin collect the ball and whip the bails off. Maxwell strikes again and suddenly England seemed to have lost their way at 78 for 3
lets the keeper collect this one as it spins away from the bat
steers this one down to long-off for a single
on the back foot to negotiate this back of a length offering carefully back to the bowler
works this one off the pads to bring the over to an end
defended away to the off side by Bell

advances down the track to this tossed up delivery, with Bell looking to hit through mid-off, but instead hits it straight back to Clarke, who gets a touch on it as it just misses the non-striker's stumps, with Morgan backing up a bit too much, and was well short of his ground

down the track and Morgan figures he has got a handle on the pitch as he looks to clear midwicket with a big hit, but instead gets this to go higher than farther, with deep midwicket steadying himself under it to take the catch. Morgan has made an inquiry with the umpire about the fact that there are too many fielders outside of the circle. Currently verifying if this is indeed the case. And would you believe it, he is correct. The umpire reverses the signal and now calls for a no-ball. Can't recall the last time that happened to be honest
turned away to square leg for a single
once again worked to square leg for one
tries to hit this past the off side, but its just not going to happen
defends this last one carefully to see an end to quite an entertaining over
defended with a straight bat back to the bowler
a little shorter as this is whisked off the pads to the fielder at deep square leg
rocks forward to defend this latest offering from Maxwell
helped off the pads to the leg side for one
drags this on leg stump as Bell picks his gap before rocking back to play a short-arm pull to deep midwicket, but doesn't get enough on it for it to clear the boundary
manages to manufacture a flick off a shortish length behind square
in the slot and driven down to long-off for a single
eases this fuller one to the same man who is able to rein it in
already in position for a front foot defence as this is played back to the bowler
afforded a little bit of width as he tries to cut this away past backward point
a little bit short and wide as this is cut away to point for a quick-run two
helped off the back foot to square leg
clipped off the pads to square leg for one
thinks about leaving this one outside off before playing a shot to it
negotiated to the leg side with soft hands
carves this to the off side with a push to bring up a well-played fifty, his 28th of his career
too short and wide as this is cut away to backward point for the easiest of singles. Also brings up the England 100 as well
shortish length which is helped off the pads to the leg side
back of a length which bounces higher than Bell expected as this catches the outside edge and spoons to the off side, but luckily there are no fielders in the vicinity
pushes this tentatively to the off side and sets off for a single, but when he sees the incoming fielder, decides to turn around and dive back to make his ground
played with the softest of hands near the body on the off side for a quick single
clipped off the pads down to deep midwicket for a brace
shortish length played with soft hands to the off side off the back foot
tosses this up quite full as Bell employs the sweep, but misses the ball. Ends up running the leg-bye
defended stoically on the front foot by Morgan
a bit shorter as Morgan is able to cut this away through point for one
worked off the back foot as he almost plays the wrong line
tries for the bunt once more, but fails to get it away
this time finds the gap through the off side for a single
shortish length which is defended off the back foot by Morgan
on the back foot again as this is worked down to the man at mid-off
full and in the slot as Morgan drives this down to deep extra-cover for a couple
a short, slower bouncer from McKay which has Bell going through his pull quite early, with the ball top-edging right over the keeper's head to the boundary
what a jaffa from McKay! this one 10 kph quicker as it rises off a length, with Bell getting tantalizing close to it as he tries to play a ramp over the slip region
steers this one just outside off to third man for a single
eased down to the man at long-on for a single
gets forward to defend this latest offering back to Maxwell
driven straight to the man at extra-cover as Morgan looks for the gap
once again fails to find it as he plays this one straight to backward point
fired in on leg as this is worked down to long-on
clipped off the pads to the leg side to retain the strike
slanting delivery which is helped to the leg side by Bell
and the first six of the innings is brought to you by Morgan as he shimmies down the track before clubbing McKay right back over long-on with the easiest of swings
defended on the front foot
cuts this away to the man at point
steered down to the man at midwicket
plays this off the back foot back to McKay to bring the 27th over to an end
starts off with a ball on a length which is defended to the off side
plays this shortish length delivery with soft hands to the man at backward point
able to slice this length ball outside off to third man
tries to get this past silly mid-on, but the fielder makes a great diving effort to save the run

too full from Faulkner as Morgan punches this straight back, with Faulkner getting his finger tips on it, with Bell short of his crease, but the ball evades the stumps once again. Second time that has happened this innings
defended with soft hands to the off side by Bell
shortish length which is defended back to the bowler
short and wide as this is cut away in front of square to the fielder
fuller one which is safely negotiated by Bell
cuts this one away, with the hope of getting it past backward point, but the fielder is equal to the task
fires in a bouncer which Bell thinks about ramping, before bending his back to get away from the line
fuller one which swings away as Bell decides to let it go, and a good decision by him as this is called a wide
finishes well as this back of a length delivery into the ribs is played back to the bowler
bowls a length ball which is defended to the off side
plays this one with soft hands behind square as the pair are able to complete a run laced with danger, as Warner makes a quick-release throw at the striker's end, with Bell well short of his crease
is afforded enough room to squeeze this away past backward point to the boundary. Was so close to the fielder, but it looks like the fielder had not picked it early
in the same area as this one is run down to the man at third man
overpitches and is met with a full face drive past the bowler to the man at long-on

in the blockhole as Bell plays this with soft hands before setting off for one. He is turned back immediately by Morgan when he sees Clarke advancing on it, who picks it up and fires in a throw which has Bell diving for safety, but the bat bounces off the pitch as he looks to ground it. The throw beats Bell's dive handsomely, and just like that Bell is gone for a well-fought 68
defended solidly by Morgan on the front foot
thuds into Morgan's pads as he looks for the flick
fires in a bouncer outside off which is left alone by the batsman
short and wide and cut away to the man at backward point
fuller one which is defended back to Johnson
short of a length delivery going down the leg side as Morgan attempts to play this past the keeper down the leg side
and he is met first up with a cheeky glance to this leg side delivery which has Haddin caught out as he looks to collect the ball from the off side
defends this next one rather carefully to the off side
short of a length which is allowed through to the keeper
short of a length which is defended to the off side
drives this next one down to long-off for an easy single
plays a lovely straight drive which is timed with such ease that it beats the two fielders converging on it quite comfortably
fuller one which is steered straight to silly mid-off
short of a length which is pulled behind square for a brace. Wasn't in complete control of that shot
overpitched and driven down the ground, but doesn't get the timing quite right on this one
short bouncer going down the leg side as Bopara doesn't offer a shot. I think he was banking on the umpire giving it a wide, but the hands are unmoved
bowls a steepler which has Bopara dropping his wrists
length pitched wide outside off as this time the umpire is snapped back into attention as he signals a wide
fires a yorker outside off which is steered to the off side
punched straight to the fielder at cover, which is greeted with a roar as the crowd think they have got a wicket, but it was hit into the ground before it carried
defended again to the off side by Bopara
able to get away this back of a length delivery which sits up to the leg side
full from Faulkner which is eased down to long-on for one
carved straight to point, who does well to get behind this one
strikes him on the pads, but it looks like he got an inside edge as the ball pops to the off side
bangs it in short and Bopara steers to backward point, wants a single but is sent back and fortunately, as David Warner was sharp in the field though no direct hit
wristy flick off the pads now through square leg and he picks up a couple of runs
on the back foot now Bopara punches through point
accurate from Coulter-Nile, Morgan just drops it towards off and gets through for a quick single
Bopara again punches through cover off the back foot
accurate again on middle and off and this time Morgan defends
and immediately the field change brings a boundary, Bopara goes the pull and his under-edge runs past the short fine leg and away to the boundary
angled across Bopara, who drives down to long-off
tip and run from Morgan, who just nudges a single towards point
ticks the scoreboard over again with another drive to long-off
Morgan tries to get adventurous by shimmying down and across outside off, but it's yorker length and he can't get the ball through the field
another bunt to the off side and another single
again Morgan tries to create something, walks down the pitch and across off stump, but his dab misses the ball
Morgan has a slash again outside off, again this one misses the bat
right on line now and Morgan defends, he's having trouble getting the ball away just at the moment
tries to force the issue now and crunches it down past the bowler but mid-off gets across to cut this off
Bopara gets hold of this one! Lovely timing as he hits through the line and lifts Coulter-Nile over long-on for six, just a really clean strike
pulls this forward of square
Bopara's gone! He's tried to flick Faulkner through the leg side but has managed only to chip it up to George Bailey at short midwicket, straightforward catch and England are in a spot of bother now
Buttler starts with a straight-bat defence as Faulkner targets middle and leg
drives down towards mid-on and can't beat the field
off the mark with a late cut, just waits on this and steers a single to third man
Faulkner goes for the yorker now and Morgan can only push it back in the direction from which it came

Morgan tries to lift the tempo while the field is up, and he gets away with a boundary. He backed away and swung hard outside off, his thickish edge flew over the infield and bounced away to the boundary
Coulter-Nile goes the bouncer and this one has been called a wide - just a touch too high
again Coulter-Nile goes short, this time outside off and not quite as high, Buttler shapes to play and then leaves it alone
quick single as Buttler nudges this to off, he's a little hesitant at first but gets to the bowler's end in time to beat Bailey's direct hit
cut away towards backward point and Morgan can't find the gap
Morgan looks to open the shoulders and smash this through midwicket, can't quite get it where he wants it though and finds mid-on
good length from Coulter-Nile means Morgan can't do much except steer this to third man for a single
this one stays a touch low and Buttler does well to nudge a couple through midwicket
nicely placed from Morgan as he brings up his half-century with a drive through the gap at extra cover
steered off the face of the bat towards backward point
Buttler uses the angle to work it through square leg
Morgan backs off a touch and tries to force a yorker through cover, finds the fielder but also a single
again the angle helps Buttler work this through midwicket but the boundary is protected so he can only pick up two
drives down towards long-on
Buttler turns this off his hips towards square leg

interesting, no wide call from the umpire now as Morgan goes for a hook to a ball down leg - that was a long way down so the umpire must have felt there was some glove on that. Don't think there was - in any case it bounced short of Haddin
well, this one has been called wide now, a bouncer that is probably just a touch too high as Morgan ducks
Morgan is in busy Michael Hussey-mode here as he pushes through cover and calls and runs quickly, hares back for a second run
defended back towards Johnson
swinging down leg but the pad of Morgan gets in the way, and he picks up a leg bye
slower now at 132kph and Buttler pushes to leg and takes a single
worked away through square leg for a couple of runs
McKay tries for the outside-off line but Buttler is good enough to whip it through leg for two more
Buttler decides he's seen enough and backs away, lifts McKay over cover but didn't quite have the timing for it to reach the boundary
Morgan advances down the pitch but has to adjust his stroke and settles for a quick single nudged to point
again Buttler uses the wrists nicely to flick this behind square from an off-stump line and his running is sharp enough to make that two
again Buttler works it through leg, makes it a pretty productive over - 10 off it with no boundaries
Buttler goes over the top now and doesn't quite time it, but had enough muscle behind it to get it away to the boundary at midwicket
slower bouncer now from Johnson and Buttler shapes to hook, then adjusts and settles for a single to leg
super shot! Morgan has had a real crack at Johnson here, uses the pace of the ball and whacks this over cover with such timing that it has cleared the boundary!
Johnson goes fuller now and Morgan drives through point
Buttler goes back in his crease and gets a single to third man off a thickish edge
Johnson goes for the yorker but Morgan is good enough to work it behind square for a single
Morgan lifts this over wide midwicket and it's well timed but reeled in on the boundary
Morgan advances but his drive can't beat cover
powerful shot! Morgan has crunched Faulkner over long-on with such good timing and strength that it's made it ten rows back in the crowd, he could really get England's total moving here
another boundary, this time he's manouevred it through square leg where there is a gap
good yorker - Morgan can't do anything but keep that out
tries for another heave through leg but doesn't quite time this one well enough to reach the square leg boundary
Buttler backs off and tries to force but can't beat the field
goes for the bouncer now and Buttler's hook bounces out to Warner at deep midwicket
Morgan backs away now and can't middle it, just gets a single down towards long-off
yet again Buttler tries to create space by backing away but Coulter-Nile does well to adjust and follows him, gives him no room and Buttler can only keep it out

oh dear, Coulter-Nile has missed the chance for a wicket - by dropping the catch himself! Buttler has top-edged and this ball flies high into the off side, Bailey comes in and seems to want the catch but Coulter-Nile calls it, then seems to be in position but grasses the chance - then grasses himself, kneeling on the ground in anguish
huge six! Morgan has timed this one magnificently, launched it way over the long-off boundary to add insult to injury for Coulter-Nile
good yorker and all Buttler can do is push it through the off side
Morgan is on fire here! He's whipped a full toss off the middle-and-leg line and helped it on its way over square leg for six
another six! Morgan has 96 now and this is the biggest six of the lot, he has launched an enormous swipe over midwicket to the long boundary - and it's gone many, many rows back into the crowd
he won't get the hundred just yet, forces a single through cover
good yorker now as Faulkner gets the length right, Buttler pushes it back to him
this yorker is not quite right though, just a fraction too short and Buttler slaps this half-volley over extra cover for four more runs
Morgan gets a low full toss but can't quite find the gap, picks up a single on the bounce to deep midwicket
Buttler backs away and takes a swing, doesn't time it and gets a single to long-on
Morgan times this but doesn't place it, finds the man at mid-off

what a way to bring up the hundred! Morgan gets a shortish ball and simply - well, he makes it look simple - helps it on its way over the keeper's head where it bounces away to the boundary. That's his sixth ODI century and he's put England on track for a hefty total
takes a swing at this through leg but just a single
once again Coulter-Nile does well to follow Buttler as he backs away, can only manage a leg bye
Buttler tries to get fancy but it doesn't work, he's walked across well outside leg and tried to scoop it over Haddin, but doesn't manage to get hold of it and Haddin gloves the ball

this one Buttler plays more conventionally, thumps it down the ground towards long-off and that looks to be clearing the rope - Marsh steps over the rope and jumps and pushes the ball back in. Hmm, he launched himself from outside the field of play and was in the air when he touched the ball to force it back into play. That must be six, surely? And has been changed subsequently
wide of off
crunched away through midwicket now and Maxwell dives to reel it in inside the boundary
Buttler gets lucky now as he swipes hard and a top edge flies over the head of Haddin for four more
struck down the ground and that's just a single
crunched through midwicket for another single
well bowled by Coulter-Nile, Buttler back off and Coulter-Nile went wide of off to keep the ball out of his reach
down leg this time as Coulter-Nile tries to follow the batsman but goes too far
thumped through the leg side now

Buttler skies this one and Clarke runs in from mid-on, appears at first to misjudge it and has to dive forward a bit but does indeed complete the catch, so Coulter-Nile gets the wicket he missed earlier, and England lose their sixth wicket, but Buttler has done a fine job
Morgan jams down on a yorker and forces a single through off
Stokes is gone first ball! He's tried to launch this over the leg side and finds the man at deep midwicket, another one for Coulter-Nile
worked away through the leg side
Morgan gets a low full toss and miscues it, finds the man at deep mid-off and that's the end of a wonderful innings of 106, Morgan has really given England's bowlers a strong target to defend
Bresnan takes a swing and picks up a single through leg side
Jordan gets a slower bouncer and can't put bat on ball
again he can't put bat on a short ball
again Faulkner goes short and again Jordan can't hit it
Jordan swipes and does make contact with this one, picks up two through the leg side despite a tight call with Bresnan completing the second at the non-striker's end

inn2.comm: and Warner starts it off with a flash to this shortish length outside off which is played to extra-cover
defended off the back foot by Warner
just works this back of a length delivery to the leg side
pushed on the back foot as this is pulled square, with the ball almost reaching the boundary
back of a length which is defended carefully off the back foot by Finch
gets solidly behind this fuller one from Rankin to end the over
fuller length delivery pitched on the leg stump and swinging in a bit, Warner is hit high on the pads, that was going down and over the top
slightly shorter on off, Warner pulls it to mid on
Finch decides to go for the lofted shot through extra-cover, but hits it quite feebly to the man at mid-off, who takes a nonchalant one-handed catch with his right
full and wide and Marsh just caresses this beautifully through point for a well-timed drive
punches this one straight to the cover fielder
tries to slap this away in front of square, but cover is back into play
pushes this across Warner as he chooses to exercise restraint
short and going down the leg side as Warner leaves this well alone
once again left
leans into a full-bloodied square drive which just races across the grass to the sweeper boundary
once again lets this steepler outside off rise to the keeper
defended cautiously to the leg side to end the over
first ball from Jordan and just hammered back to long-off by Warner who is in a mood to attack
pushes this back of a length delivery to the off side to set off for a quick single
Jordan tries him with a shorter one which Marsh looks to pull, but is late on as the ball hits him in the stomach. Didn't show too much pain after so all is well
directs this full and wide delivery to the fielder at silly mid-off
bowls one which goes across him as Marsh ends up playing it back to the bowler
back of a length which climbs appreciably as Marsh decides to leave it alone
fuller one which is driven to deep midwicket by Warner, but not hit will enough for it to reach the boundary
decides to shoulder arms to this next one going across him
drives this full length one to the fielder at long-off
wide and in the slot as Marsh is given the freedom to use his arms and just drill this to the extra-cover boundary for four
pushes this fuller one to the off side for a quick single
Warner just crunches this fuller one from Rankin straight back over the bowler's head for a boundary
content to shoulder arms to this 139 kph delivery from Jordan
thinks about a shot before defending this riser from Jordan on the back foot

another full one, this time on the pads, as Marsh looks for the clip, but ends up being hit outside the line. Marsh presses on for the run, and is lucky to make his ground before the throw from the mid-off fielder. Was very tough and go that one
surprises Warner with a short one which has him ducking for cover

Jordan takes a spectacular return catch to remove the dangerous Warner as the left-hander hammers back a length ball to the right of Jordan, who instinctively stretches out his hand to grab hold of the chance. Amazing that it even managed to stick, especially with how hard Warner had struck that back. Removes a dangerous thorn in the backside for the English
back of a length which Clarke gets successfully behind the line of
happy to shoulder arms to this riser going outside off
manages to work this back of a length delivery on the pads for a single
short and wide as this is cut away behind point
gets forward to this full one from Rankin as the ball rolls to the off side
on the back foot and defended back to the bowler
full and on the pads as Marsh fails to get this away
too short from Jordan on this track as Clarke seems to have all eternity to pick his spot and pull this through midwicket for a boundary
gets his line and length on a better spot, but Clarke still looking to be aggressive as this is slapped away to the off side
defends this length ball from Jordan with ease
plays a pick-up pull shot of sorts which is helped down to fine leg for a brace
short and wide and Jordan is punished as Clarke cuts this brutally through the vacant gap at point to the boundary
length outside off which is shouldered arms to
starts off with a loosener which is played straight to cover, who does well to field it
defended off the back foot by Marsh to the bowler

going down the leg side as Marsh looks for a glance down the leg side, but is late on it as it hits the thigh pad on its way to the keeper, who takes a good low catch to his right. They go for the appeal, but the umpire saw the impact on the thigh
on to this one in a flash as he sees it short and rocks back to pull this fiercely to the midwicket boundary
defends this next one sensibly to the leg side
able to steer this one outside off to the fielder at third man
too full on the pads as this is eased comfortably to the fine leg boundary for four
drives this fuller one straight to silly mid-off
this time directs it to the man at silly mid-on, as they continue to look for an opportunity to score
defends this one swinging in on him to the right of the bowler
rocks forward to defend this latest offering from Stokes
too short from Stokes and Marsh punishes him with a pull shot to midwicket. Stokes struggling to get his lines right here
length ball coming in to the batsman as Clarke is resolute in defence
pushed onto the back foot to play this away to the leg side
defended on the front foot to the bowler
once again fails to get this away to the leg side
turned off the hip to the leg side for one
played to the off side for a single and to retain the strike. The throw does come in, and would have had Marsh short if he had struck down the stumps
just lasers this fuller one right back at the non-striker's stumps. Looks in glorious touch today
back of a length delivery outside off, Clarke cuts it away to square third man
pushed to the fielder at mid-off
back of a length outside off which is cut away to deep extra-cover
helps this one off the pads towards square leg
strikes him on the pads, but this was definitely outside the line
gets forward to defend this offering from Bresnan
helps this off the hips to square leg
fuller one which is clipped to square leg for a brace
slower short ball which Clarke decides to duck under, even though he could have gone after him
banged in short outside off, Clarke swivels and pulls it away to backward square leg
back of a length which is run down to short third man for a single
delivers a shorter one which is steered straight to silly mid-on
drives this fuller one through deep extra-cover for a couple
pushes this off the back foot to the fielder at long-on
tries to guide this past Root, but the Yorkshireman dives fully to his right to get close to it
and the secret weapon has struck as he gets the Australian captain to slice to the man just in front of point, as Ballance takes a good low catch
just caresses this for a single to long-on to get off the mark
back of a length outside off which is pushed to the off side by Bailey
Bailey looks to be in good touch as he cuts this away to the off side, but doesn't have enough on it for it to reach all the way to the boundary

Bresnan strikes Marsh on the pads as the bowler goes up for an appeal. Dharmasena is not interested though, and after a brief consultation, they decide to go for the review. The review shows that this is definitely pitching outside leg though, so in turns out be a dud review for England. Oh well
shortish length which is angled down to third man, but is kept to a single only
pitches this short, with the ball sitting up for Bailey, as he is able to get into his pull shot early, and then go for another swivel after for the photographers
defended away to the off side to finish the over
fuller one which is swept to the man at fine leg
this one seems to rush on Marsh as he late cuts this to the fielder at backward point
this time slaps it away to the fielder at deep extra-cover
this time steered behind square on the leg side for a brace
tries to get this away on the leg side, but fails to do so
defended to the off side to end the over
Stokes is on now, he bowls full and wide of off and Marsh drives to mid-off
straighter line now and Marsh only manages an inside edge onto pad and away to the leg side
Bailey goes back into the crease and works an easy single to deep midwicket
lovely placement and timing as Marsh waits on a late cut and picks the gap between point and gully, this races along the ground for four
swivels a pull through square leg now
Stokes tests Bailey in that avenue outside off that troubled him in the Tests, and a thickish edge runs away past slip to third man
Root is around the wicket to Bailey, who uses the feet and pushes to off
Bailey goes for the sweep on a fullish ball and misses, there's half an lbw shout but that looked to be pitching outside leg from the angle
pushed to a diving cover fieldsman who keeps the batsmen in place
off-stump line and Marsh pushes a quick single which tests Bailey's groin - he gets through but perhaps a touch gingerly
advances and drives but can't beat mid-on
straight-bat defence now from Bailey
crunching drive from Marsh, this sizzles off the bat and runs along the ground between mid-off and cover for a boundary
on the pads now and Marsh clips a couple through midwicket, again Bailey is able to make the runs at a sharp enough pace
steers a single behind point and that's the half-century for Marsh
pushed away to point
uses the wrists to flick this from outside off through midwicket
Stokes bangs in a bouncer but it's too short - that's a wide
wide of off now and Marsh cuts it away towards third man
Root angles it in from around the wicket and Marsh pushes to cover
more leg-sidey now and Marsh can't quite beat the field
flat and a touch short, Marsh rocks back and cuts hard to the sweeper on the off side
Bailey uses the feet now and nudges a run through the leg side
flattish again at 95kph and Marsh whips a single to leg
down leg side from Root, Bailey glances a single
Bailey works this off the pads through square leg
again Bailey is able to whip through square and again he picks up two runs
Bailey gets a shorter one from Rankin now and pulls through square leg
tip and run - Marsh drops it at his feet and Bailey calls him through for a quick, but safe, single
straightish from Rankin and Bailey works it through leg
Marsh opens the face on this and steers it to point
Bailey goes the sweep now and gets another run off Root
drives to mid-off and there's a misfield - that's a bonus run
another run to the man in the deep on the leg side

Root strikes again! And it's a huge wicket, it's the established Shaun Marsh who goes back to try a cut but the ball is too straight and skids through to clip the off stump. What a strike for Root - he's got two!
nudged away through leg to get off the mark
Bailey uses the feet nicely here to rock back and cut through point, doesn't quite get it to the boundary but picks up two
Rankin angles this in towards the pads of Maxwell, who flicks through square leg
Bailey swivels on his toes and pulls through square to keep the scoreboard ticking, but there's a lot of ticking required now
Maxwell opens the face and tries to steer this to third man - there's a slip in place so it's risky, but he doesn't make contact at all
this time Maxwell does get the open face to steer the ball down into the ground and to third man
accurate from Rankin, Bailey goes back and tries to work to leg but only gets it back to the bowler

Rankin strikes and that's pretty much dead plumb lbw. Angled in and Bailey doesn't move the feet, misses the ball and is struck directly in front. Dharmasena gives it out and that's one of the easier calls he'll have to make in his career
Maxwell pushes uppishly and shouts from the fielders as this lands just safely wide of midwicket
Haddin leans forward to defend his first ball
pushed away to the leg side again
again Haddin can't quite beat the field
gets off the mark now with a nudge just wide of midwicket
forceful flick from Maxwell as he gets this through the midwicket gap
wrong line from Rankin now, this one skews down leg side and is unquestionably a wide
nudged away for a quick single towards mid-on
banged in short of a length and Haddin steers it to backward point
again Haddin rocks back into the crease and can't beat point
beaten outside off, Rankin follows the shorter ones with a fuller ball that draws Haddin out and he can't get bat on ball
solidly defended by Haddin
Haddin flashes hard outside off and this fizzes past the edge and is put down by Buttler
driven down to long-off for a single
Haddin drives for an easy single to long-on
pushed away to cover but can't find the gap
Maxwell gets adventurous now and it works! He's gone for the reverse ... hmm, sweep, I suppose, but it's more of a swipe that just clears square leg and runs away to the boundary
pushed away to the leg side
nudges a single through point
pulled away through square leg
Haddin defends from his crease
Haddin squirts this away through square leg
swivels a pull through the leg side and they're quick enough to run two
Jordan gives Maxwell some width and Maxwell drives into the turf and through cover
tries to whip this off the hips but it runs away for a leg bye
Root continues - and why not? - and Maxwell drives a single through midwicket
pushed away to leg but can't find a gap
Haddin goes for the sweep now and Jordan collects in the deep
pushed away to mid-on
cut hard but can't beat point
nudged away behind square leg for a single
Haddin goes the big swing but can't really get it away
defended edgily down into the leg
solidly defended by Haddin
picks up a couple of runs now with a gentle nudge through square leg - great running
Haddin swings hard again and again doesn't time it through midwicket
Maxwell gets a shortish one on leg and pulls it around to fine leg
Maxwell goes the reverse sweep again and gets it past the man at backward point
once again Maxwell picks the gap behind backward point with a reverse sweep - how does Cook stop that?
he's tried it again from a full toss and this is four more! This one runs finer and there is nothing England can do to stop it
tries again but this one was quicker from Root and Maxwell didn't get hold of it
pushed away uppishly into the leg side
full toss from Root and Maxwell can't put it away, just gets a single to deep midwicket
banged in short and down leg side, so that's a wide
Maxwell takes a big swing at this on off stump and just edges it back onto the pads

nice ball from Jordan that nips back in off the seam and Maxwell tries to steer it to third man, but it nips in so much it strikes him on the thigh pad - Jordan asks the lbw question but it looked high
Maxwell goes the big swipe to a short ball and can't beat midwicket
Maxwell opens the face and steers this behind point for a single to third man
that's some intent from Maxwell! He has advanced and flat-batted this with muscle and power past mid-off for a boundary
shorter of length and this one Maxwell can't get away
ordinary start though as this one angles down leg side
pushed away to leg and no run is available
down leg side again and these are all useful runs for Australia
worked away through the leg side
driven to cover and there's a misfield that allows a run
pushed away to the off side
Maxwell gets another boundary through the backward point area but not with a reverse shot this time - it's just a really well placed late cut
defended back down the pitch
Haddin starts the powerplay sedately enough, just a nudged single to mid-off
good timing from Maxwell, albeit from a poor delivery - low full toss just a touch down leg and Maxwell helps it on its way behind fine leg. Almost a yorker - almost, but not quite
Maxwell hooks this one over square leg and picks up three more
Haddin tries to force through cover but can't find the gap
shortish and Haddin pulls through square leg
driven down to mid-off but too hard - means they can't take the single
leg bye is all that Maxwell can manage as Jordan aims at the leg-stump
Jordan angles this in and targets the stumps - almost gets through Haddin's defences. Actually, defences is the wrong word as he was trying a slog over leg
clipped away through midwicket for another couple of runs
Haddin finds the off-side boundary now as Jordan gives him something short and wide, Haddin crunches a cut through cover point

super shot! Haddin may just be capable of rescuing Australia as he did in the Tests! He's just lifted this over extra cover and there's no man out there so if he hits it cleanly - as he did - it's a safe shot for four
down leg and Haddin works it away behind square

no, it won't be Haddin who rescues Australia! Bresnan has got him, extra bounce did the trick as Haddin tried to slam this down the ground and top-edged it up towards mid-off and Cook was steady under the ball to take the catch
plays with soft hands to the off side as Maxwell brings up a well-played fifty. Australia will hope he can continue on longer
Coulter-Nile swings hard and can't get it away but they hurry through for a tight leg bye
Maxwell is now reversing the hook off a fast bowler! And it's worked, he's got this away for a boundary towards third man
but that's the end of Maxwell! He's pulled straight to midwicket and Bopara takes the catch. Two key wickets in the over, and are Australia's chances over as well?
pushed away to point
going down the leg side as this is left alone by the batsman
another ball angling down the pads as this comes off the thigh pad for a leg-bye
gets his line right just outside off as Faulkner thinks about pushing at it, before retreating the bat
defended with soft hands to the off side for a tight single
gets this down to backward square for one
fuller one down the pads which is clipped behind square on the leg side
drives this one back to the bowler to bring the over to an end
driven straight to mid-off by Coulter-Nile
able to pull this down to deep square leg for a single
shortish length outside off which is cut towards backward point, but can't get past the fielder
back of a length and pulled down to deep midwicket

Nathan plays the most flukey hook I have ever seen as he commits early to this short of a length delivery which flies high over fine leg, with the fielder running it down, before realising it was going over
tried to pull again, but got a top-edge to third man for a couple
eases this one down to long-on for oen
looks to dab this to the leg side, but the fielder is quick on it
speared in on middle and off as Nathan does well to dig it out
slower ball which is helped to square leg

pushes this one gently to the off side with the intent to run a quick single, but is hesitant as he sees his partner turn back, but then the pair decide to risk it, and luckily enough another fumble affords Nathan that extra split-second to get in the dive
fuller one shaping in as Nathan inside-edges, but luckily away from the stumps
drives this fuller one straight back to Stokes, who does a rolling dive to stop the ball
tries to work this away to the leg side, but can't pinch a single
going down the leg side as the umpire calls a wide

plays this softly to the man at point as they embark on a quick single, but the throw would have had the non-striker run out by miles. Morgan, after firing in the throw, grabs hold of his right knee. Hopefully he hasn't done himself in there
going down the leg side again as this time the ball strikes the pads
this time gets it to pitch fuller as this strikes Faulkner on the toes, but hits outside the line of the stumps, despite the appeal from the bowler
once again slanting down the pads as Faulkner helps this off his hops for a single
back of a length coming in to the batsman as this is played to the off side
back of a length and punched off the back foot softly for one
tries to carve this through the point region, but hits it straight to the fielder
drives this length ball to the man at extra-cover
is solid in defence as he rocks onto the front foot
able to get this one just past backward point as this is played down to third man
another pull shot to the man at fine leg as Nathan continues to believe Australia can pull through
defends this one carefully with soft hands to the off side for one
swinging down the pads as Nathan tries to get this fine down the leg side, but the keeper does well to get behind it
ends up playing this reverse-swinging delivery back to the bowler
fires in a leg side yorker which Nathan fails to get away. Really should have done better with this one

gets one to swing in from just outside off as Nathan goes for the big heave down the ground, but misses the ball as this careens low into his right pad, which is definitely in line of the stumps. Doesn't look to have got an inside-edge as this one continued onto the pads, so fairplay to the Australians for not wasting the review
defends this one tentatively to the off side
low full toss just outside off as this is played straight to long-on
tries from round the wicket as this fuller one is defended to the off side
tries to get away a fuller one to the leg side, but silly mid-on is all over it
back of a length and straight as Johnson just plays this to the leg side
prods forward to defend this fuller one to bring the over to an end
just eases this one down to the fielder at long-on
pitches this slightly short as this one goes down the leg side
turns this fuller one away to midwicket for one
yorker on middle which is drilled straight to silly mid-on
length going down the pads as Johnson attempts to get this away
leans into a drive through the covers, but is kept to just one
tries a slower one on a length which Johnson reads late as this goes harmlessly past the bat to the keeper
length going down the pads as this is worked down to long-on
low full toss which is angled to the off side, beating a diving silly mid-on, before being recovered by long-on
back of a length outside off which is punched straight to the covers
squirts this one through point for a single to sweeper cover
pitches wide outside off as he looks to engineer a reverse-scoop over fine leg, but can't get a connection on it
again down the same line, but a tad wider

and Bopara picks up a wicket as he has Johnson going after this length ball outside off, with a gentle push which catches a faint outside edge to the keeper behind. Leaves England just one wicket away from squaring the series after two
and Faulkner has decided it is time to go as he deposits this length ball straight into the midwicket stand
Faulkner has stepped up a few gears as he just whacks this short one well over the square leg boundary for a huge six
pitches this up as Faulkner is able to get it down to long-on for a single. This leaves McKay exposed at the other end, but he too can hit a long ball
length coming in as this one is inside-edged onto the pad, with Stokes thinking he has got his man
McKay gets forward to this length ball on and around off
just plays this one to the fielder at cover, but doesn't want the run, as Faulkner will be back on strike next over
length outside off which is pushed to the covers
short ball just outside off which is defended off the back foot to the off side
drills this length ball straight to silly mid-off
short delivery on the off stump, McKay pulls it to deep mid-wicket
Bresnan surprises him with a full toss on the hips which is helped down to the man at deep fine leg for a single
tries to run this down to the man at third man, but hits it more square than fine as the over comes to an end
fires in a fuller one which is worked down to the fielder at long-off
swinging into the pads as this is eased down to long-on
able to squirt this full and wide one behind to third man, but can't beat the fielder. Still gains two valuable runs for his team
bludgeons this with his rendition of Dhoni's helicopter, but this one unfortunately finds mid-off

dropped back of a length and this is all Faulkner needed as he goes after this with a pull shot. Root, running in from deep square leg, is able to get a hand on it before the boundary, but the momentum carries him over, ends up being called a six by the third umpire. Root really deserved that one as he was in control, but unfortunately cost his side two extra runs at the least
again they are able to squirt this behind down to third man, but are kept to just one
slower ball outside off which is played tentatively towards point
another short slower ball which ends up being played back to th ebowler
angling down the pads as this is helped off the hips by Faulkner, who is able to make it back for two

on the back foot as this is pulled down to deep midwicket, with the pair running for their lives as they are able to scamper back for the second, and beat the incoming throw from the deep at the keeper's end
once again negotiates this shortish length slower ball to the leg side for a single
decides to fire in a bouncer which for all intensive purposes should have been called a wide by the third umpire, but Dharmasena just walks away from the spot. England lucky to get away with that one
this one was heading down the pads as Faulkner decides to go with it and hit over cow corner, but gets a bit too early into the shot, with the ball falling safely to his right
gets in a yorker on middle and leg which Faulkner is able to dig out successfully
back of a length and just crunched over the midwicket boundary for a huge six. Such a clean swing of the blade as this one just rises and rises into the stands

in the slot and suddenly images of Ishant start to come to the surface as Faulkner clears his front leg, and then clears the long-on boundary with another easy swing of the bat. This is sensational hitting from the Tasmanian allrounder
third time not so lucky for Faulkner as clearly the adrenaline is getting to him now. Is lucky not to get bowled as this goes down the leg stump to the keeper
fires it in on the blockhole as Faulkner eases this one down to long-on for a single, and more importantly for Australia, retain the striek
tries a slower bouncer which Faulkner is too early on as the ball runs off the face, and bounces over the keeper's outstretched gloves to the third man rope. Australia now need 8 off 5

sees this one early as Faulkner readies himself to this shorter one just outside off, before pulling this magnificently to midwicket for a one-bounce four which bifurcates the two fielders on the leg side

able to find the gap on the off side as he backs away to squirt this away through extra-cover, beating the fielder near the 30-yard circle, as this travels to the rope, sparking off scenes of delirium across the Gabba
